text: We are using Zultys phone system which is an VoIP system but is not integrated with HubSpot such as Aircall, Dialpad, etc...).  So if an established company joins HubSpot, are they porting all their numbers over to systems such as Aircall, RingCentral, Dialpad, etc..?
Or do they us the Outbound calling feature that uses Twilio to double dial two phone numbers?
They basically just build out an iframe to show the dialing and calling feature in HubSpot
not the most complex setup
This message was deleted.
But are they not using the SDK?
I don't get how others are getting the audio to text into HubSpot when HubSpot sdk says 'only outgoing calls supported'
They are still using the SDK
for call recordings: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/calling-sdk#logging-the-call-in-HubSpot>
Pretty simple setup, basically you setup an engagement with the details of the call
Sorry, very new to HubSpot.  Doesn't this just mean your recording that a call was made only?
you'll definitely want to delete those id and secret from this channel
what's the problem you're running into?
sorry not sure I understand
They are saying they can take the audio of the call, and transcribe it and store in HubSpot to analyze
Yep so you as the app owner pass a url for the recording to HubSpot
Recording call I guess have different meanings.  I am talking actual recording the audio of both parties.  In their sales pitch they sent us a conversation we had.
it would be the audio of both parties
You have to provide the recording though... a url
And then they have a process that converts the audio to text?
yep: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions>
Do you record inbound calls as well?
no I use HubSpot calling
I've done it before though
Would you have a minute to jump on a call? Understand if don't.
sure
what is your end goal?
Want to run in localhost
what are you trying to do?
Want to create a HubSpot module
a crm card? or a workflow action?
crm card

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:

• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs

Thanks SJ, <@U04RMM1MF0A> just to get a little bit of background what are you trying to do with crm cards. To setup CRM cards you don't need to create a server or anything so you shouldn't need to mess with the client id and secret yet.

What to do? Please don’t tell me I will need to replace the modules on the pages with the updated modules? That would be ridiculous
Hi <@U04R6PR925R> can you please explain a little more about what you are trying to accomplish?
They are visible in preview. Man…
Sounds like a caching issue. Try adding random query parameters to the url
Hi Arlo! Thanks for your feedback. We've passed it on to the Quotes team.

Hi <@U01E3692GUF>, these changes are related to recent product upgrades to our available billing frequencies release that allows customers to set payment terms to at payment, specified date payments, and relative payments. In this particular example, all of the existing line items are set to be due at a future date and time.  Since our current system evaluates First Payment as `payment due at checkout` and these items aren't due at checkout, we would expect the returned number to return $0.

The team is aware that this may cause some confusion for customers and they are working to expand our totals calculations to more appropriately describe payment terms on Quoting. We do appreciate that you've shared this feedback with us and they will keep it top of mind as they continue to evolve this feature set over time.

Totally cool, but AJ, it's not *confusion* it's that it just broke existing templates that relied upon the old calculation method.

We found a workaround by using a different one, but things like this have become a recurring theme on the quotes product. It's one thing to change things, it's another to make breaking changes ithout notice.

Although I fully grok that you can't possibly imagine what myriad combinations of custom templating & coding that people are choosing to use in the quotes product, that just means that quotes needs to be treated like an API and either have versioning so that you can break shit and it doesn't impact anybody on the LTS, or you have to give substantial notice about future changes, deprecations etc.

Instead, it *feels* like HubSpot product is treating quotes like a SaaS product release, which makes sense for products where it's just buttons and clicks and sorting and moving, but the moment that customization and coding come into play, the product is no longer a pure play SaaS and really can't be versioned that way.

Totally understandable Arlo and I am sorry for the frustration this caused. I'll pass this additional info back to the team. If you have more feedback, please feel free to pass that along to me in a DM and ill make sure it gets straight to the team :slightly_smiling_face:
